fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.simulators.interfaces

Interface SimulationManagementI

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    RTAtomicSimulatorI, RTSimulatorI, SimulatorI
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AtomicEngine, AtomicRTEngine, CoordinationEngine, CoordinationRTEngine, HIOA_AtomicEngine, HIOA_AtomicRTEngine, SimulationEngine

    public interface SimulationManagementI
    The interface SimulationManagementI declares the methods used by simulation engines to manage simulation runs.

    Description

    Invariant

     invariant      true

    Created on : 2018-06-01

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void doStandAloneSimulation(double simulationStartTime, double simulationDuration)
      do a stand alone simulation lasting simulatedTimeDuration and starting at startTime.
      void finaliseSimulation()
      finalise the simulation, disposing all resources and reinitialising the models and simulators so that a new simulation run can be undertaken.
      SimulationReportI getFinalReport()
      return the simulation report of the last simulation run.
      Time getSimulationEndTime()
      return the time at which the simulation ends.
      Time getTimeOfStart()
      return the time at which the simulation started.
      boolean isSimulationRunning()
      return true if a simulation run is currently executing.
      void setSimulationRunParameters(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> simParams)
      set the simulation run parameters before performing the simulation run.
      void stopSimulation()
      interrupt the current simulation and trigger the sending of the simulation report to the client if appropriately connected.

                         throws java.lang.Exception

        Contract

 post   true            // no postcondition.

      • doStandAloneSimulation

        void doStandAloneSimulation(double simulationStartTime,
                            double simulationDuration)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        do a stand alone simulation lasting simulatedTimeDuration and starting at startTime.

        Contract

         pre     simulationStartTime >= 0.0
 pre     simulationStartTime  < Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY
 pre     simulationDuration > 0.0
 pre     simulationDuration <= Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY
 post    !isSimulationRunning()
        Parameters:
        simulationStartTime - time at which the simulation starts interpreted in the model simulation time.
        simulationDuration - duration of the simulation interpreted in the model simulation time.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
